subject: Leadership
title: Scenario Planning
description: A quick win: understand Scenario Planning.

hook.text: Shell Oil survived the 1973 oil crisis because they'd already imagined it. Their competitors were blindsided.

buildup.text: Scenario planning explores multiple plausible futures rather than betting on a single forecast. It builds resilience.

discovery.text: The method: identify key uncertainties, create 3-4 distinct scenarios, then develop strategies that work across several.

twist.text: Scenarios aren't predictions. Their value is stretching thinkingâ€”leaders who've imagined disruption respond faster.

climax.text: Regular scenario exercises build agility. When the unexpected arrives, you've already rehearsed a response.

punchline.text: You can't predict the future. But you can prepare for it.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of scenario planning?
options: To explore multiple futures and build resilience
